Imaging Festival 2017

Celebrate Summer & share your passion for photography at the IMAGING FESTIVAL 2017

Burgess Hill - 17th June 2017 | London - 24th June 2017

Join Park Cameras at our annual Imaging Festival this June where you can share your passion for photography, learn something new and pick up a great deal!

On the day you’ll find some incredible one-day-only offers, a number of bite-size seminars from experts in the photographic industry, and product experts available all day from over 20 leading brands including Canon, Nikon, Fujifilm, GoPro, Manfrotto, Olympus, Panasonic, Sigma, Sony, Tamron and Vanguard to name just a few! We’ll also have a number of strictly limited offers, so don’t forget to arrive early!

The Gadget Show Presenter Jon Bentley at the Imaging Festival, plus many more seminars!

This year we have the widest range of FREE seminars that we have ever had at an Imaging Festival, including a seminar with The Gadget Show's Jon Bentley and Amateur Photographer magazine Group Editor Nigel Atherton [Burgess Hill store only]! Please see below for the whole range and to reserve your space, plus find out how you can get the sensor cleaned on your Canon DSLR for free!

  • FREE Seminars
  • FREE Prize Draws
  • FREE Expert Advice
  • EXCLUSIVE Offers
  • FREE Sensor Cleans
  • FREE Giveaways

Keep up-to-date with the latest information about the imaging festival & to be the first to know our special one-day only offers!

Canon EOS C200

Customers visiting the Park Cameras Imaging Festival on either the 17th June (Burgess Hill) or 24th June (London) will be one of the first in the UK to get their hands on the recently announced Canon EOS C200! The C200 is a professional 4K/UHD/50P entry into the Cinema EOS range, offering flexibility and ease-of-use for single-user operation. Technical experts from Canon UK will be on-hand throughout the day to offer help and advice on this new addition to Canon’s Cinema EOS line-up.

Get hands-on with the Panasonic LUMIX GH5

Meet professional videographer Nick Driftwood at Park Cameras in Burgess Hill on Saturday 17th June, and get hands on with the flagship camera in the Panasonic LUMIX G range of mirrorless cameras: the GH5. As a highly talented videographer, Nick has been in the trusted position as a Panasonic ambassador for a number years, and as such as been able to use his experience and passion for film to test out the LUMIX GH5, feeding back information, and test shots / videos back to Panasonic to assist with the development of the product. There is therefore, no-one better to guide you through the camera, and to inspire your videography. No booking is necessary, simply come in store on the 17th June, and visit the Panasonic area of the store.

Seek out the new and catch the shot of a lifetime with the Nikon D7500

Visit the Park Cameras Imaging Festival in Burgess Hill or London, and you’ll be able to get hands on with the latest DSLR in Nikon’s line-up; the D7500! In addition to this, on the 24th June you can enjoy coffee, cakes and cameras with professional photographer and Nikon ambassador Jeremy Walker. He will be sharing with you his experience and techniques in order to inspire and help you bring your photography to the next level, as well as help with any questions you might have about Nikon cameras or lenses. Click here to learn more & book your place.

Imaging Festival Seminars

For many years, the Imaging Festival at Park Cameras has been designed in a way to help our customers get the very best out of their passion for photography by holding a number of free seminars. For 2017 this is no different, with a real mix of different speakers available to help you learn more about a wide-variety of genres of photography.

With seminars and some hands-on sessions, visiting Park Cameras for the Imaging Festival will give you a fantastic opportunity to learn more about how to take great shots with advice from those talented and knowledgeable enough to do this for a day job!

Please note, due to the popularity of our bitesize seminars, places will be restricted to a maximum of two sessions per customer at each store. We will try to allocate additional spaces, where possible.

  • Burgess Hill Seminars
  • London Seminars
  • Free Canon Sensor Cleaning

Imaging Festival Opening Times:09:00 - 17:30

Shooting Fantastic Portrait Images with Will Stedman and the Sony a9

09:15 - 10:15 or13:30 - 14:30

Join Sony Ambassador and local portrait and wedding photographer Will Stedman for this 60-minute session as he demonstrates how you can shoot some fantastic portrait shots, using basic lighting principles including 5-point lighting.

Based in the studio at Park Cameras, this is a great opportunity to learn how you can enhance your photography skills, under the guidance of an experienced photographer along with seeing the newSony a9 in action.

Will is a wedding, lifestyle and commercial photographer based locally in Guildford, Surrey. Amongst shooting a range of weddings at a wide variety of locations, he has also worked for companies including Wagamama, Talkback Thames and Freemantle media photographing adverts, headshots and more.

If you own a camera, please feel free to bring this along on the day!

During this 60-minute session Jon and Nigel will be accepting questions from the audience.

A new chapter in camera history: the Fujifilm GFX 50S with Wayne Johns

11:30 - 12:30

The Fujifilm GFX-50S burst on to the scene as one of the first Mirrorless Medium Format Digital Cameras earlier in 2017, packing a huge sensor into a smaller form factor than we were used to seeing – meaning we were no longer using Medium Format cameras for just studio photography.

Join professional photographer Wayne Johns as he shares his in-depth knowledge of the GFX 50S and range of lenses, demonstrating how it combines outstanding resolution of 51.4 megapixels with exceptional tones, advanced colour reproduction alongside a range of high-performance lenses to produce some truly fantastic results – all within a camera that you can easily fit in your hands!

Technical experts from Fujifilm UK will also be on-hand to offer further help and advice, and to allow you the chance to get hands-on with Fujifilm's new medium format mirrorless camera system.

Book Now

The Canon EOS 5D Mark IV - A Landscape Sensation with David Clapp

12:05 - 13:05

Join award-winning landscape and travel photographer David Clapp as he takes a closer look at the Canon EOS 5D Mark IV and why, when shooting landscapes, the technologies found within the camera help deliver uncompromising image quality in a variety of different ways.

During this session, David will share some of his most compelling imagery shot in a whole variety of different locations, and share his tips and tricks to help you take your own sensational landscape photos.

After the session, there will be plenty of time to get your questions answered from David, as well as to get hands-on with the latest range of cameras and lenses in the brand-new Canon area located in the Burgess Hill store.

Book early and be one of the first 20 people to receive David Clapp's photo book 'Transitions'.

This taster session is suitable for those who are thinking about or have bought Adobe Lightroom and are looking for the most efficient workflow related to manipulating their digital images.

Travel photography tips and tricks with photographer Jacob James

13:00 - 14:00

Join travel and cultural documentary photographer Jacob James for this 60-minute seminar as he describes how he uses Panasonic Lumix G cameras and lenses (including the newLUMIX GH5) in a whole variety of different sessions both within the UK and worldwide.

Jacob has a passion for immersing himself in new cultures and experiences, and looks to capture the human side of life for people right across the globe. During this session he’ll explain how you can use the flexibility of thePanasonic LUMIX G range to capture your own fantastic images, sharing his tips and tricks.

Throughout the session there will be plenty of time to have your questions answered – plus there will be an opportunity after the session to speak further to Jacob or a representative from Panasonic UK, as well as get hands on with the latest cameras and lenses – including the newPanasonic LEICA 8-18mm.

X Marks the Spot

14:30 - 15:30

With a whole host of new cameras available in the line-up, attending this session will allow you to learn more about cameras including the FujifilmX-T2,X-T20 and more – including some of the new XF lenses that have also landed in the last year.

An inspirational talker, and teacher, Wayne Johns will share his experience and knowledge along the way, as you can also expect to get yourself some facetime with these new cameras and lenses to practice these new abilities.

Get creative. Edit your images with ease with the help of Wacom

15:10 - 16:10

Products will include the Intuos tablets which are ideal to help unleash your creativity, whatever your style or level of skill, and with the Intuos Pen, will feel as natural to use as working with Pen and paper.

In addition to this, Wacom will show you how you can enjoy total creative freedom with the superior MobileStudio range. Attending this course, you’ll also learn the advantages of using Wacom tablets from with Adobe Photoshop Lightroom and Photoshop CC to help edit your images.

Long Lens Landscapes with the Canon EOS 5D Mark IV with David Clapp

During this session, David will also share how using the Canon EOS 5D Mark IV can assist you with your landscape photography, sharing tips and tricks to help you get the best out of the camera.

Throughout this 60-minute seminar, David will share some of his most compelling imagery shot in a whole variety of different locations, and share his tips and tricks to help you take your own sensational landscape photos.

Coffee, cakes and cameras with Park Cameras and the Nikon School

10:00 - 12:00 or14:00 - 16:00

Park Cameras in conjunction with the Nikon School are pleased to offer customers the opportunity to attend a special seminar at the Nikon School hosted by Nikon Ambassador Jeremy Walker.

Join award winning landscape photographer and Nikon Ambassador Jeremy Walker who will be doing a talk about his photography. Jeremy has been producing eye-catching landscape and architectural imagery for advertising, editorial and design clients around the globe for over twenty years. He will be sharing with you his experience and techniques in order to inspire and help you bring your photography to the next level.

Also on hand will be staff from the Nikon School to discuss your product requirements and to demonstrate the range of Nikon equipment held at the school.

Tickets, which cost £20, are strictly limited and will include refreshments and time to talk to the staff at the Nikon School.

At the end of this session, attendees will receive a voucher covering the cost of this session, to spend on selected Nikon items at Park Cameras in London.

11:00 - 11:45or15:00 - 15:45

Book Now

Always in the Background: The Road to Clint Eastwood with Keith Bernstein

12:00 - 12:45

Photographer and Sony Ambassador Keith Bernstein has had the opportunity to shoot some unique photos a whole range of different situations, meeting a whole number of interesting people along the way and winning a variety of different awards.

In this 45-minute session, Keith will talk about the unforeseen and totally unpredictable route that led him to work with Clint Eastwood. More than 20 years as a photojournalist has had a direct impact on this career, leading him to become Clint Film still photographer for Clint Eastwood’s last seven movies (including Sully, American Sniper and Eye in the Sky) with another two planned for 2017!

The two seemingly different worlds of photojournalism and cinema proved to be linked and connected in ways that Keith has seen when looking back. This talk will show you a range of shots from his time working with Clint Eastwood and how these two contrasting subject areas are brought together.

Book Now

Led by Park Cameras tutorSteve Marley, he’ll share a variety of tips and tricks to help you get some fantastic images and help you look at the streets of London from a different perspective. This photo walk is suitable for all skill levels.

Canon Sensor Cleaning

Throughout the Imaging Festival, Canon users can get their Digital SLR sensor cleaned for FREE by technical experts from Canon UKs service centre (although we are accepting charitable donations going to a local charity.)

There are set times throughout the day to drop your camera in, and you can then collect it around 1 hour later. Simply click on the time that you would like to bring your camera into us to book your slot. We are able to allow one camera per person, and the camera must be a Canon. There is a maximum number of cameras we can clean per slot. You can also bring in your camera on the day, although we cannot guarantee the sensor clean will be done within the hour.

The Canon technicians will clean the accessible surface of the sensor as best possible. We cannot guarantee to remove every particle on the surface, but in the majority of cases, the sensor is left very clean. Very occasionally, particles can get between the filter and the sensor and if this happens, the Canon technicians will not remove the filter to clean beneath it. This would have to be booked in with Canon at a separate time.

Please help us to help you and ensure that when you deliver your camera for your FREE sensor clean that you do so along with the following:

  • Camera Body Cap / Lens
  • Fully Charged Battery

and that you have downloaded any image files or data to your satisfaction and have removed the memory card(s).

Whilst conducting the initial checks on the camera, we will contact you before continuing if we feel it is unsafe to clean the sensor - due to existing scratches or stubborn marks that could cause further damage.
